Horace Ezra Bixby (May 8, 1826 - August 1, 1912) was a steamboat pilot on the 
Mississippi-Missouri-Ohio river system from the late 1840s until his death in 1912
. Bixby is notable in his own right for his high standing in his profession, for his 
technical contributions to it, and for his service in the American Civil War. ... later
